overview: The purpose of this Act is to provide communities the opportunity to protest the renewal of certain liquor licenses. [1] This bill amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, to apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses, and the renewal of existing liquor licenses, for on-site sale and consumption by the drink. [1] The description provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [1]
appropriations: The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding appropriations. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding assumptions and methodology for any fiscal impact. [1]
agency_impact: The measure provides that the Liquor Commission or other licensing agency of each county shall deny the renewal of certain current liquor licenses upon receipt of sufficient protests. [1] This will affect proceedings for license renewals that are begun after the Act's effective date. [1]
economic_impact: The provided legislative documents do not contain any information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [1]
policy_impact: This Act amends section 281-39.5, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which currently applies only to the issuance of new liquor licenses, but not the renewal of current licenses. [1] The legislature finds this creates a safe harbor for existing establishments seeking a renewal of their liquor license. [1] This bill amends the statute so that it shall apply to both the issuance of new liquor licenses and the renewal of existing liquor licenses. [1]
